A part of my current project is management of simple key/value properties (=
string/string) for (more or less) any resource in the system.

My use-cases=
/scenarios are:

1) Some resource in the system contains a link with the re=
l-type "additional-properties". This link points to the list of additional =
properties for that resource (at the URL "{additional-properties}").

2) Th=
e URL "{additional-properties}" returns a list of key/value properties for =
reading.

3) For each key/value in the list there will be links for a) edit=
ing the value of the key, and 2) deleting the key.

3a) Editing is as simpl=
e as PUTing a new value to the URL.

3b) Deleting a key is as simple as a H=
TTP DELETE of the URL.

4) The list also contains a link for adding new pro=
perties.

What would be a suitable (simple) media-type for this?

I am cons=
idering ATOM (which is nice for lists), but that seems like quite a bit of =
overkill. HTML might also be useful (but does not support PUT, but POST wou=
ld be okay too). A home-grown application/vnd.abc+xml is also a possibility=
.

What would you guys do?

Thanks, J=F8rn
